subclassFeature.name: Warding Flare
entries: When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to impose Disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker before it hits or misses.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Revealing Light
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can present your Holy Symbol and cast {@spell See Invisibility} without expending a spell slot. When you cast it in this way, your allies also gain the benefit of the spell while within 10 feet of you. Until the spell ends, you emit {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Bright Light} in a 10-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Dim Light} for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early as a Bonus Action.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Corona of Light
entries: As a {@action Magic|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6|Magic Action}, you cause yourself to emit an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it (no action required). You emit {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Bright Light} in a 60-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Dim Light} for an additional 30 feet. Your enemies in the {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Bright Light} have Disadvantage on saving throws against your Radiance of the Dawn and any spell that deals Fire or Radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Trickery Domain
entries: The Trickery Domain offers magic of deception, illusion, and stealth. Clerics who wield this magic are a disruptive force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, stealing from the rich, freeing captives, and flouting hollow traditions. They prefer subterfuge, pranks, and theft rather than direct confrontation.

Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. They embody the forces of change and social upheaval, and they're patrons of thieves, scoundrels, gamblers, rebels, and liberators. Religious orders that operate in secret, especially those that seek to undermine oppressive governments or hierarchies, also draw on the power of the Trickery Domain.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Trickster
entries: As an action, you can choose yourself or a willing creature within 30 feet of yourself to gain Advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Trickery Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Trickery Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Charm Person}, {@spell Disguise Self}, {@spell Invisibility}, {@spell Pass without Trace}

subclassFeature.name: Invoke Duplicity
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to create an illusory duplicate of yourself.

As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, and you create a perfect visual illusion of yourself in the space you left. The illusion lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition or dismiss it as a Bonus Action.
While the illusion persists, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Cast Spells
entries: You can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses.

items.name: Distract
entries: When both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have Advantage on attack rolls against that creature, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.

items.name: Move
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is within 120 feet of yourself, and you can then teleport, swapping places with the illusion

subclassFeature.name: Trickster's Magic
entries: If you cast a spell of the Illusion school using a spell slot, you can change the spell's casting time to a Bonus Action for this casting, provided the spell's casting time is normally an action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Duplicity
entries: The illusion of your Invoke Duplicity has grown more powerful. When you create it, you can teleport up to 120 feet rather than 30 feet, and when you move it, you can move it up to 60 feet rather than 30 feet. In addition, when you and your allies make attack rolls against a creature within 5 feet of the illusion, the attack rolls have Advantage. Finally, when the illusion ends, you or a creature of your choice within 5 feet of it regains a number of Hit Points equal to your Cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: War Domain
entries: War has many manifestations. It can make heroes of ordinary people. It can be desperate and horrific, with acts of cruelty and cowardice eclipsing instances of excellence and courage. Clerics who tap into the magic of the War Domain excel in battle, inspiring others to fight the good fight or offering acts of violence as prayers.

Gods of the War Domain watch over warriors and reward them for their great deeds. They include champions of honor and chivalry as well as gods of destruction and pillage. Other war gods take a more neutral stance, promoting war in all its manifestations and supporting warriors in any circumstance.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the War Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: War Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Divine Favor}, {@spell Magic Weapon}, {@spell Shield of Faith}, {@spell Spiritual Weapon}

subclassFeature.name: Guided Strike
entries: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you misses with an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to expend one use of your Channel Divinity and give that roll a +10 bonus, potentially causing it to hit.

subclassFeature.name: War Priest
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the Mastery property of one kind of Simple or Martial weapon with which you have proficiency. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, you can change the kind of weapon you chose to another eligible kind.

In addition, you can make one weapon attack as a Bonus Action. You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: War God's Blessing
entries: Whenever you cast {@spell Shield} of Faith on another creature, the spell also affects you.

In addition, you can cast the spell once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Battle
entries: You gain resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Land
entries: The Circle of the Land is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition. These Druids meet within sacred circles of trees or standing stones to whisper primal secrets in Druidic. The circle's wisest members preside as the chief priests of communities that hold to the Old Faith and serve as advisors to the rulers of those folk.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection to nature infuses you with the ability to cast certain spells. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, choose one type of land: arid, polar, temperate, or tropical. Consult the table below that corresponds to the chosen type; you have the spells prepared there that are listed for your Druid level and lower.

entries.caption: Polar Land
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud}, {@spell Hold Person}, {@spell Ray of Frost}

entries.caption: Tropical Land
rows: {@spell Acid Splash}, {@spell Ray of Sickness}, {@spell Web}

subclassFeature.name: Land's Aid
entries: You can channel the power of the land itself to bolster friends and harm foes. As a {@action Magic|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6|Magic Action}, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape and choose a point within 60 feet of yourself. Vitality-giving flowers and life-draining thorns appear for a moment in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature of your choice in that area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
In addition, one creature of your choice in that area regains {@dice 2d6} Hit Points.
When you reach certain Druid levels, the damage and healing increase by {@dice 1d6}: 10th level ({@dice 3d6}) and 14th level ({@dice 4d6}).

subclassFeature.name: Natural Recovery
entries: Tapping into nature, you can conserve and recover your magical power. You can cast one of the spells of 1st-level or higher that you have prepared from your Circle Spells feature without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a{@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}before you do so again.

In addition, when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your Druid level (round up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher. For example, if you're a 6th-level Druid, you can recover up to three levels worth of spell slots. You can recover a 3rd-level spell slot, a 2nd-level spell slot and a 1st-level spell slot, or three 1st-level spell slots. Once you recover spell slots with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Ward
entries: Your bond with the land protects you. You are immune to the Poisoned condition, and you have resistance to a damage type associated with your current land choice in the Circle Spells feature, as shown in the Nature's Ward table.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Sanctuary
entries: {@skill Nature} can rise up to protect you and your allies. As a {@action Magic|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6|Magic Action}, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape and cause spectral trees and vines to appear in a 15-foot cube on ground within 120 feet of yourself. They last there for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition. You and your allies have Half Cover while in that area, and your allies gain the current damage resistance of your Nature's Ward while there.
As a Bonus Action, you can move the cube up to 60 feet to ground within 120 feet of yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Forms
entries: The rites of your circle grant you the ability to transform into more dangerous animal forms; the maximum Challenge Rating for your Wild Shape is 1.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Moon
entries: Druids of the Circle of the Moon draw on the magic of the moon to transform themselves and to guard the wilds. Their order gathers under the full moon to share news and perform rituals. They wander the deepest parts of the wilderness, where they might go for weeks on end before crossing paths with another person, let alone another Druid.

Changeable as the moon, a Druid of this circle might prowl as a great cat one night, soar over the treetops as an eagle the next day, and crash through the undergrowth in bear form to drive off a trespassing monster. The wild is in the Druid's blood.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Wild Shape
entries: You have learned ancient techniques that allow you to channel the magic of the moon to bolster yourself while using Wild Shape, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Armor Class
entries: When you assume a Wild Shape form, compare the Beast's AC to your AC (including any armor you're wearing but not a Shield). While in that form, you use whichever AC is higher.

items.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: When you assume a Wild Shape form, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the form's Hit Points or three times your Druid level, whichever number is lower. For example, if you turn into a Wolf (11 HP) as a 5th-level Druid, you gain 11 Temporary Hit Points, since three times your Druid level is higher than the Wolf's Hit Points

items.name: Abjuration Spells
entries: While in a Wild Shape form, you can cast your Abjuration spells, except for any spell that has a Material component with a cost specified or that consumes its Material component.

items.name: Moonbeam
entries: You always have the {@spell Moonbeam} spell prepared while in a Wild Shape form, and you can cast the spell in that form without material components.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Circle Forms
entries: The maximum Challenge Rating of your Wild Shape now equals your Druid level divided by 3 (round down). In addition, each of your attacks in a Wild Shape form can deal its normal damage type or Radiant damage. You make this choice each time you hit with those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Moonlight Step
entries: You magically transport yourself, reappearing amid a burst of moonlight. As a Bonus Action, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, and you have Advantage on the next attack roll you make before the end of this turn.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}. You can also regain uses by expending a spell slot of 2nd level or higher for each use you want to restore (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Form
entries: The power of the moon suffuses you, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Movable Moonbeam
entries: While your Moonbeam is active, you can move it up to 60 feet at the start of each of your turns (no action required).

items.name: Shared Moonlight
entries: Whenever you use Moonlight Step, you can also teleport one willing creature. That creature must be within 10 feet of you, and you teleport it to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of your destination space.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Sea
entries: Druids of the Circle of the Sea draw on the tempestuous natural forces of the world's oceans and storms. Some view themselves as embodiments of nature's wrath, seeking vengeance against those who despoil the natural world. Others seek mystical unity with nature by attuning themselves to the ebb and flow of the tides, following the rush of currents and waves, and listening to the inscrutable whispers and roars of the winds.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection to this circle ensures that you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of the Sea Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Circle of the Sea Spells
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud}, {@spell Gust of Wind}, {@spell Ray of Frost}, {@spell Shatter}, {@spell Thunderwave}

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Sea
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape to manifest an aura that takes the form of ocean spray that surrounds you. The aura lasts for 10 minutes. It ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition, dismiss it (no action required), or manifest the aura again.

At the end of each of your turns, you can choose another creature you can see within 10 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Spell Save DC or take Thunder damage and, if the creature is Large or smaller, be pushed up to 15 feet away from you. To determine this damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one die).

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic Affinity
entries: You always have the {@spell Water Breathing} spell prepared. In addition, you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} equal to your Speed. If you use Wild Shape to assume a form that lacks a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, that form gains your {@variantrule Swim Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Stormborn
entries: Your Wrath of the Sea confers two more benefits while active:

items.name: Flight
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} equal to your Speed.

items.name: Resistance
entries: You have resistance to Cold, Lighting, and Thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Oceanic Gift
entries: Whenever you use Wrath of the Sea, you can manifest the aura around one willing creature within 60 feet of you rather than manifesting it around yourself. The creature gains all the benefits of the aura and uses your Spell Save DC and Wisdom modifier for it.
In addition, you can manifest the aura around both the other creature and yourself if you expend two uses of your Wild Shape, instead of one, when manifesting the aura.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You have attuned yourself with the elemental forces of the multiverse. You know the Elementalism cantrip.

In addition, at the start of your turn, you can spend 1 Discipline Point to imbue yourself with elemental energy. The energy lasts for 10 minutes or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition. You gain the following benefits for the duration:

items.name: Elemental Strikes
entries: Whenever you hit with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, you can cause it to deal your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage rather than its normal damage type. When you deal one of these types with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, you can also force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you can move the target up to 10 feet toward or away from you, as elemental energy swirls around it.

items.name: Reach
entries: When you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, your reach is 10 feet greater than normal, as elemental energy extends from you.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Elements
entries: The tradition of the Four Elements encompasses Monks who tap into the power of the Elemental Planes through their practice of martial arts. Some of these Monks focus on a single element, learning to wreathe their fists in fire and cause explosive bursts of flame, or to wield mighty gusts of icy wind. Others weave the elements together and learn a variety of techniques to harness the appropriate elemental force for each particular circumstance.

subclassFeature.name: Enviromental Burst
entries: As a {@action Magic|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6|Magic Action}, you can spend 2 Discipline Points to cause environmental energy to burst in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of yourself. Choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning. Each creature in the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage of the chosen type equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
Before or after you take this action, you can make one {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} as a Bonus Action.

subclassFeature.name: Stride of the Elements
entries: When you use your Step of the Wind, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} and {@variantrule Swim Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} equal to your Speed for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Epitome
entries: When you use the Elemental Attunement feature, you also gain the following benefits for the duration:

items.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to one of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning. At the start of each of your turns, you can change this choice.

items.name: Destructive Stride
entries: When you use your Step of the Wind, your Speed increases by 20 feet until the end of the turn. For that duration, any creature of your choice takes damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die when you enter a space within 5 feet of it. The damage is the same type you chose for this feature's damage resistance. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

items.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can deal extra damage to a target equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die when you hit it with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}. The damage is the same type you chose for this feature's damage resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Open Hand Technique
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of the following effects on that target:

items.name: Addle
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it can't take Reactions until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Push
entries: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you push it up to 15 feet away from yourself.

items.name: Topple
entries: The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, or it has the {@condition Prone} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Hand
entries: Warriors of the Hand are masters of unarmed combat. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents and manipulate their own energy to protect themselves from harm.

subclassFeature.name: Wholeness of Body
entries: You gain the ability to heal yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can spend 1 Discipline Point and roll your Martial Arts die. You regain a number of Hit Points equal to the number rolled plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 Hit Point regained).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Fleet Step
entries: You can easily stride out of harm's way; you can use the Step of the Wind option of your Martial Discipline feature without spending any Discipline Points.

subclassFeature.name: Quivering Palm
entries: You gain the ability to set up lethal vibrations in someone's body. When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, you can spend 3 Discipline Points to start these imperceptible vibrations, which last for a number of days equal to your Monk level. The vibrations are harmless unless you use your action to end them. To do so, you and the target must be on the same plane of existence. When you use this action, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d12} + your Monk level of Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time. You can end the vibrations harmlessly without using an action.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Arts
entries: Through rigorous training, you have learned to draw on the power of the Shadowfell, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Darkness
entries: You can spend 1 Discipline Point to cast the {@spell Darkness} spell without any spell components. You can see within the spell's area when you cast it with this feature. While the spell persists, you can move its area of darkness to a space within 60 feet of you at the start of each of your turns.

items.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Shadowy Figments
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion} cantrip and use Wisdom as the spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Shadow
entries: Warriors of Shadow practice stealth and subterfuge, channeling their reservoirs of power to harness the power of the Shadowfell. They are at home in darkness, able to draw gloom around themselves to hide, to leap from shadow to shadow, and even to take on a wraithlike form of living shadow.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Step
entries: While entirely within {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Dim Light} or Darkness, you can use a Bonus Action to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Dim Light} or Darkness. You then have Advantage on the next melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Shadow Step
entries: You can draw on your connection to shadow to empower your teleportation. When you use your Shadow Step, you can spend 1 Discipline Point to remove the requirement that you must start and end in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Dim Light} or Darkness for that use of the feature. As part of this Bonus Action, you can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} immediately after the teleportation.

subclassFeature.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries: As a Bonus Action while entirely within {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Dim Light} or Darkness, you can spend 3 Discipline Points to shroud yourself with magical darkness for 1 minute, until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition, or until you end your turn in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||Bright Light}. While shrouded in darkness, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Invisibility
entries: You have the {@condition Invisible|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition.

items.name: Partially Incorporeal
entries: You can move through creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, but you take {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside a creature or an object.

items.name: Shadow Flurry
entries: You can use your Flurry of Blows without spending any Discipline Points.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Wrath
entries: As an action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to conjure grasping spectral vines around nearby creatures. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the Restrained condition for 1 minute. A Restrained creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Ancients
entries: The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the first elves and the rituals of Druids. Paladins who swear this oath cherish the light; they love the beautiful and life-giving things of the world more than any principles of honor, courage, and justice. They adorn their armor and clothing with images of growing things—leaves, antlers, or flowers—to reflect their commitment to preserving life and light in the world.

entries.name: Tenets of the Ancients
entries: Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of Ancients vary, Paladins of this oath share these tenets.

entries.name: Kindle the Light
entries: Through your acts of mercy, kindness, and forgiveness, kindle the light of hope in the world, beating back despair.

entries.name: Shelter the Light
entries: Where life flourishes, stand against the forces that would render it barren.

entries.name: Preserve Your Own Light
entries: Delight in song, laughter, and art. If you allow the light to die in your own heart, you can't preserve it in the world.

entries.name: Be the Light
entries: Be a glorious beacon for all who live in despair. Let the light of your joy and courage shine forth in all your deeds.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Ancients Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Warding
entries: Ancient magic lies so heavily upon you that it forms an eldritch ward, blunting energy from beyond the Material Plane; you and your allies have resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage while in your Aura of Protection.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Sentinel
entries: When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points and not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 Hit Point instead, and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to three times your Paladin level. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.
Additionally, you suffer none of the drawbacks of old age, and you can't be aged magically.

subclassFeature.name: Elder Champion
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can imbue your Aura of Protection with primal power, granting the following benefits for 1 minute or until you end them as a Bonus Action:

items.name: Diminish Defiance
entries: Enemies in the aura have Disadvantage on saving throws against your spells and Channel Divinity options.

items.name: Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 Hit Points.

items.name: Swift Spells
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can cast it using a Bonus Action instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Devotion
entries: The Oath of Devotion binds a Paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice and order. These Paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some, for better or worse, hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their gods' tenets as the measure of their devotion. They hold angels as their ideals and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.

entries.name: Tenets of Devotion
entries: Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of Devotion vary, Paladins of this oath share these tenets.

entries.name: Honesty
entries: Don't lie or cheat. Let your word be your promise.

entries.name: Courage
entries: Never fear to act, though caution is wise.

entries.name: Compassion
entries: Aid others, protect the weak, and punish those who threaten them. Show mercy to your foes, but temper it with wisdom. Honor. Treat others with fairness, and let your honorable deeds be an example to them.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Devotion Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of Devotion Spells
rows: {@spell Protection from Evil And Good}, {@spell Shield of Faith}
{@spell Freedom of Movement}, {@spell Guardian of Faith}

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Weapon
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to imbue one Simple or Martial weapon that you are holding with positive energy. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls you make with that weapon (minimum bonus of +1), and each time you hit with it, you cause it to deal its normal damage type or Radiant damage.
The weapon also emits {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} in a 20-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} 20 feet beyond that.
You can end this effect as a Bonus Action. This effect also ends if you aren't holding or carrying the weapon or if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Devotion
entries: You and your allies are immune to the {@condition Charmed} condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a {@condition Charmed} ally enters the aura, that condition is suppressed while the ally is there.

subclassFeature.name: Smite of Protection
entries: Your magical smites now radiate protective energy. Whenever you cast any of your Paladin's Smite spells, you and your allies in your Aura of Protection have Half Cover until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Nimbus
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can imbue your Aura of Protection with holy power, granting the following benefits for 1 minute or until you end them as a Bonus Action:

items.name: Holy Ward
entries: You have Advantage on any saving throw you are forced to make by a Fiend or an Undead.

items.name: Radiant Damage
entries: Whenever an enemy starts its turn in the aura, that creature takes Radiant damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus plus your Charisma modifier.

items.name: Sunlight
entries: The aura is filled with {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} that is sunlight.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} unless you expend a Spell Slot of at least 4th level when you use it again.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Smite
entries: Immediately after you deal damage to a creature with any of your Paladin's Smite spells, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity and distribute Temporary Hit Points to creatures of your choice within 30 feet of yourself, which can include you. The total number of Temporary Hit Points equals {@dice 2d8} + your Paladin level, divided among the chosen creatures however you like.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Glory
entries: Paladins who take the Oath of Glory believe they and their companions are destined to achieve glory through deeds of heroism. They train diligently and encourage their companions so they're all ready when destiny calls.

entries.name: Tenets of Glory
entries: Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of Glory vary, Paladins of this oath share these tenets.

entries.name: Actions over Words
entries: Strive to be known by glorious deeds, not words.

entries.name: Challenges Are but Tests
entries: Face hardships with courage, and encourage your allies to face them with you.

entries.name: Hone the Body
entries: Like raw stone, your body must be worked so its potential can be realized.

entries.name: Discipline the Soul
entries: You must marshal the discipline to overcome failings within yourself that threaten to dim the glory of you and your friends.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Glory Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Peerless Athlete
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to augment your athleticism. For 1 hour, you have Advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks; you can carry, push, drag, and lift twice as much weight as normal; and the distance of your long and high jumps increases by 10 feet (this extra distance costs movement as normal).

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Alacricity
entries: Your Speed increases by 10 feet, and the Speed of any ally who starts their turn in your Aura of Protection increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Glorious Defense
entries: You can turn defense into a sudden strike. When you or another creature you can see within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to grant a bonus to the target's AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). If the attack misses, you can make one weapon attack against the attacker as part of this Reaction, provided the attacker is within your weapon's range.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

subclassFeature.name: Living Legend
entries: You can empower yourself with the legends—whether true or exaggerated—of your great deeds. As a Bonus Action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items.name: Charismatic
entries: You are blessed with an otherworldly presence, gaining Advantage on all Charisma checks.

items.name: Saving Throw Reroll
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can use your Reaction to reroll it. You must use this new roll.

items.name: Unerring Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack roll with a weapon and miss, you can cause that attack to hit instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Vengeance
entries: The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed grievously evil acts. When evil armies slaughter helpless villagers, when a tyrant defies the will of the gods, when a thieves' guild grows too violent and powerful, when a dragon rampages through the countryside—at times like these, paladins arise and swear an Oath of Vengeance to set right what has gone wrong.

entries.name: Tenets of Vengeance
entries: Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of Vengeance vary, Paladins of this oath share these tenets.

entries.name: Fight the Greater Evil
entries: Through your acts of mercy, kindness, and forgiveness, kindle the light of hope in the world, beating back despair.

entries.name: No Mercy for the Wicked
entries: Where life flourishes, stand against the forces that would render it barren.

entries.name: By Any Means Necessary
entries: Delight in song, laughter, and art. If you allow the light to die in your own heart, you can't preserve it in the world.

entries.name: Restitution
entries: Be a glorious beacon for all who live in despair. Let the light of your joy and courage shine forth in all your deeds.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Vengeance Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Vow of Enmity
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You gain Advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute.

If the creature drops to 0 Hit Points before the vow ends, you can transfer the vow to a different creature within 30 feet of yourself (no action required). You can make this transfer no more than once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Avenger
entries: Your supernatural focus helps you close off a foe's retreat. When you hit a creature with an Opportunity {@action Attack}, you can reduce the creature's Speed to 0, and you can then move up to half your Speed as part of the same Reaction. This movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Vengeance
entries: Immediately after a creature under the effect of your Vow of Enmity hits or misses with an attack, you can use your Reaction to make a melee attack against that creature if it's within range.

subclassFeature.name: Avenging Angel
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can imbue your Aura of Protection with holy power, granting the following benefits for 10 minutes or until you end them as a Bonus Action:

items.name: Flight
entries: You sprout spectral wings on your back. You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} equal to your Speed and can Hover.

items.name: Frightful Aura
entries: Whenever an enemy starts its turn in the aura, that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. {@action Attack} rolls against the {@condition Frightened} creature have Advantage.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Beast Master
entries: A Beast Master ranger forms a mystical bond with a special beast, drawing on primal magic and a deep attunement to the natural world.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Companion
entries: You magically summon a primal beast, which draws strength from your bond with nature. The beast is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. Choose its stat block—{@creature Beast of the Land|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, {@creature Beast of the Sea|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, or {@creature Beast of the Sky|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}—which uses your Proficiency Bonus (PB) in several places. You also determine the kind of animal the beast is, choosing a kind appropriate for the stat block. Whatever kind you choose, the beast bears primal markings, indicating its supernatural origin.

In combat, the beast acts during your turn. It can move and use its Reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a Bonus Action on your turn to command it to take a different action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. You can also sacrifice one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action to command the beast to take the {@action Attack} action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition, the beast can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.

If the beast has died within the last hour, you can you use your action to touch it and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The beast returns to life after 1 minute with all its Hit Points restored.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, you can summon a different primal beast. The new beast appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, and you choose its stat block and appearance. If you already have a beast from this feature, it vanishes when the new beast appears. The beast vanishes if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Exceptional Training
entries: When you use your Bonus Action to command your Primal Companion beast to take an action, you can also command it to take the {@action Dash}, Disengage, {@action Dodge}, or {@action Help} action as a Bonus Action.
In addition, whenever the beast hits with an attack and deals damage, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Fury
entries: When you command your Primal Companion beast to take the {@action Attack} action, the beast can make two attacks.
In addition, the first time each turn it hits a creature under the effect of your Hunter's Mark spell, the beast deals extra Force damage equal to the bonus damage of that spell.

subclassFeature.name: Share Spells
entries: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your Primal Companion beast with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: You have mastered the art of creating frightening ambushes, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Ambusher's Leap
entries: At the start of the first turn of each combat, your Speed increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn.

items.name: Frighten
entries: Once per turn when you attack a creature and hit it with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d8} Psychic damage to the target and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Frightened} condition until the start of your next turn. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

items.name: Initiative Bonus
entries: When you roll Initiative, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Gloom Stalker
entries: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, wielding magic drawn from the Shadowfell to combat enemies that lurk in darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Gloom Stalker Magic
entries: The magic of the Shadowfell ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Ranger level specified in the Gloom Stalker Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Sight
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on {@sense Darkvision}. While entirely in Darkness, you have the {@condition Invisible|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition to any creature that relies on {@sense Darkvision} to see you in that darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Mind
entries: You have honed your ability to resist the mindaltering powers of your prey. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Flurry
entries: When you use the Frighten effect of your Dread Ambusher feature, you can cause one of the following additional effects:

items.name: Sudden Strike
entries: You can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and that is within the weapon's range.

items.name: Mass Fear
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, a creature has the {@condition Frightened} condition until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: You can dodge with wisps of supernatural shadow around you. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your Reaction to impose Disadvantage on that roll. If the attack then misses, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter
entries: You stalk prey in the wilds and elsewhere, using your abilities as a Hunter to protect nature and people everywhere from forces that would destroy them.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Lore
entries: You can call on the forces of nature to reveal certain strengths and weaknesses of your prey. While a creature is marked by your Hunter's Mark, you know whether that creature has any damage or condition immunities, damage resistances, or damage vulnerabilities, and if the creature has any, you know what they are.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Prey
entries: You gain one of the following feature options of your choice.

items.name: Colossus Slayer
entries: Your tenacity can wear down even the most resilient foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage to the target if it's missing any of its Hit Points. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

items.name: Horde Breaker
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with a weapon, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target, that is within the weapon's range, and that you haven't attacked this turn.

items.name: Retaliator
entries: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you attacks you, you can use your Reaction to make one attack with a weapon against that creature, whether or not it hit you.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Tactics
entries: You gain one of the following feature options of your choice.

items.name: Evasion
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that lets you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition.

items.name: Hunter's Leap
entries: If an enemy you can see enters a space within 5 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

items.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your Reaction to halve the attack's damage against you (round down).

subclassFeature.name: Superior Hunter's Prey
entries: You gain another feature option of your choice from the Hunter's Prey feature.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
entries: You gain another feature option of your choice from the Defensive Tactics feature.

subclassFeature.name: Assassin
entries: An Assassin's training focuses on the grim art of death, using stealth, poison, and disguise to eliminate foes with deadly efficiency. While some Rogues who follow this path are hired killers, spies, or bounty hunters, the capabilities of this subclass are equally useful for adventurers facing a variety of monstrous enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Assassinate
entries: You are adept at getting the drop on a target, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Initiative
entries: You have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

items.name: Surprising Strikes
entries: During the first round of each combat, you have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. If your Sneak Attack hits any target during that round, the target takes extra damage of the weapon's type equal to your Rogue level.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item Disguise Kit|PHB} and Poisoner's Kit.

subclassFeature.name: Infiltration Expertise
entries: You are expert at posing as someone else to aid your infiltrations. While in a disguise created using your {@item Disguise Kit|PHB}, you have Advantage on any Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check you make while pretending to be someone else. You can also unerringly mimic another person's speech, handwriting, or both if you have spent at least one hour studying each one.

subclassFeature.name: Envenom Weapons
entries: When you use the Poison option of your Cunning Strike, the target also takes {@damage 2d6} Poison damage whenever it fails the saving throw. This damage ignores resistance to Poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Death Strike
entries: When you hit with your Sneak Attack on the first round of a combat, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 8} + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus), or the attack's damage is doubled against the target.

subclassFeature.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: You've learned how to land a strike and then slip away without reprisal. If you make a melee attack against a creature during your turn, that creature can't make Opportunity Attacks against you for the rest of that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rakish Audacity
entries: When you roll Initiative, you can give yourself a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier.

You also gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack; you don't need Advantage on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you are within 5 feet of it, no other creatures are within 5 feet of you, and you don't have Disadvantage on the attack roll. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply to you.

subclassFeature.name: Swashbuckler
entries: As a Swashbuckler, you focus on the art of the blade, bringing speed, elegance, and charm to your combat style—topped off with an exquisite flourish of panache. You excel in single combat, and your methods make a duel look like a flamboyant performance.

subclassFeature.name: Panache
entries: You have practiced new ways to use your Sneak Attack. The following effects are now among your Cunning Strike options.

entries.name: Goad (Cost: 1d6)
entries: The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or until the end of its next turn, the target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you and can't make Opportunity Attacks against targets other than you.

entries.name: Awe (Cost: 3d6)
entries: Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed} condition until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Dashing Strikes
entries: You have practiced new ways to use your Sneak Attack. The following effects are now among your Cunning Strike options.

entries.name: Parrying Stance (Cost: 2d6)
entries: Roll a {@dice d6}. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled.

entries.name: Invigorate (Cost: 2d6)
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of that creature's next turn, whenever it makes an attack roll or a saving throw, it can roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Master Duelist
entries: Immediately after you use your Sneak Attack, you can make another attack against the same target, provided you are within 5 feet of it and no other creatures are within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Fast Hands
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can do one of the following:

items.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check to pick a lock or disarm a trap with Thieves' Tools or to pick a pocket.

items.name: Use an Object
entries: Take the {@action Use an Object} action, or take the {@action Magic|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6|Magic Action} to use a magic item that requires that action.

subclassFeature.name: Second-Story Work
entries: You have trained to reach especially hard-toreach places, granting you these benefits:

items.name: Climber
entries: You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed. On your turn, you can move on a ceiling without making an ability check, provided there is at least one handhold during the move, but you fall if you end the turn there without a handhold.

items.name: Jumper
entries: Your jump distance is determined by your Dexterity rather than your Strength.

subclassFeature.name: Thief
entries: A mix of burglar, treasure hunter, and explorer, you are the consummate adventurer. In addition to improving your agility and stealthiness, you gain abilities useful for delving into ruins and getting maximum benefit from the magic items you find there.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Sneak
entries: You gain the following Cunning Strike option.

entries.name: Stealth Attack (Cost: 1d6)
entries: If you have the {@action Hide} action's {@condition Invisible|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition, this attack doesn't end that condition on you if you end the turn behind Three-Quarters Cover or Total Cover.

subclassFeature.name: Use Magic Device
entries: In your treasure hunting, you have learned how to maximize use of magic items, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Attunement
entries: You can attune to up to four magic items at once.

items.name: Charges
entries: Whenever you use a magic item property that expends charges, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 6, you use the property without expending the charges.

items.name: Scrolls
entries: You can use any {@item Spell Scroll} that bears a cantrip or a 1st-level Spell. You can also try to use any {@item Spell Scroll} that contains a higher-level Spell, but you must first succeed on an Intelligence Check (Arcana) with a DC equal to 10 + the Spell's level. On a successful check, you cast the Spell from the scroll, and you use Intelligence as your Spellcasting Ability for this casting. On a failed check, the scroll disintegrates.

subclassFeature.name: Thief's Reflexes
entries: You are adept at laying ambushes and quickly escaping danger. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal Initiative and your second turn at your Initiative minus 10.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Trickster
entries: Some Rogues enhance their fine-honed skills of stealth and agility with Arcane spells, learning magical tricks to aid them in their trade. Some Arcane Tricksters use their talents as pickpockets and burglars, while others are pranksters, mischief-makers, or adventurers.

subclassFeature.name: Mage Hand Legerdemain
entries: When you cast {@spell Mage Hand}, you can make the spectral hand {@condition invisible}. You can control the hand as a Bonus Action, instead of an action, and through it, you can use Thieves' Tools and make Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to cast spells. See the Player's Handbook for the rules on spellcasting. The information below details how you use those rules as an Arcane Trickster.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know three cantrips: Mage Hand and two other cantrips of your choice from the Arcane spell list.
Whenever you gain a Rogue level, you can replace one of your cantrips, except Mage Hand, with another cantrip of your choice from the Arcane spell list.
When you reach 10th level in this class, you learn another Arcane cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Arcane Trickster Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of 1st+ Level
entries: You prepare a list of spells of 1st level and higher that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three 1st-level spells from the Arcane spell list, two of which must be from the Enchantment and Illusion schools of magic.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Rogue levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Arcane Trickster Spellcasting table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Arcane spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a 7th-level Rogue, your list of prepared spells can include six Arcane spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the spells you know with another spell of your choice from the Arcane spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Arcane Trickster spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an Arcane Focus as a Spellcasting Focus for the spells you prepare for this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Ambush
entries: If you have the {@condition Invisible|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition when you cast a spell on a creature, it has Disadvantage on any saving throw it makes against the spell on the same turn.

subclassFeature.name: Versatile Trickster
entries: You gain the ability to distract targets with your Mage Hand. When you use the Disarm or Trip options of your Cunning Strike, you can also target that option at a creature within 5 feet of the spectral hand.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Thief
entries: You gain the ability to magically steal the knowledge of how to cast a spell from another spellcaster.

Immediately after a creature casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area of effect, you can use your Reaction to force the creature to make a saving throw with its spellcasting ability modifier. The DC equals your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, you negate the spell's effect against you, and you steal the knowledge of the spell if it is at least 1st level and of a level you can cast (it doesn't need to be an Arcane spell). For the next 8 hours, you know the spell and can cast it using your spell slots. The creature can't cast that spell until the 8 hours have passed.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}.

feat.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feat. However, if you are at least 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} you make with Ranged Weapons.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a Melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a Melee Weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die, and you must use the new roll. The Weapon must have the Two-Handed or Versatile property to gain this benefit.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Protection
entries: Immediately after a creature you can see makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} and hits a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to interpose your Shield and impose a −2 penalty on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, potentially turning it into a miss. You must be wielding a Shield to use this Reaction.

feat.name: Fighting Style: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you make the extra attack of the {@variantrule Light|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} weapon property, you can add your Ability Modifier to the damage of the extra attack.

spell.name: Banishing Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}

entries: As you hit the creature, your strike erupts with divine power. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 5d10} Force damage from the attack. If the attack reduces the target to 50 Hit Points or fewer, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration.

While in the demiplane, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition. When the spell ends on the target, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

spell.name: Blinding Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}

entries: As you hit the target, your strike flares with light. The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 3d8} Radiant damage from the attack, and the target has the Blinded condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Blinded target repeats the saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Barrage

m.text: a melee or ranged weapon worth at least 1 CP

entries: You brandish the weapon used to cast the spell and conjure similar spectral weapons (or ammunition appropriate to the weapon) that  shoot forward and then disappear. Each creature of your choice that you can see in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} Force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the  damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Volley

m.text: a melee or ranged weapon worth at least 1 CP

entries: You brandish the weapon used to cast the spell and choose a point within range. Hundreds of similar spectral weapons (or ammunition appropriate to the weapon) fall in a volley from above and then disappear. Each creature of your choice that you can see in a 40-foot-radius, 20- foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} Force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Divine Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a target with a melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: As you hit the target, your strike glows with divine power. The target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage from the attack. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} if the target is a Fiend or an  Undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the  damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Elementalism
entries: You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range:

items.name: Beckon Air
entries: You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and  close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren't affected.

items.name: Beckon Earth
entries: You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

items.name: Beckon Fire
entries: You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot cube. You choose the color and scent, and the  embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke's scent lingers for 1 minute.

items.name: Beckon Water
entries: You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a  5-foot cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a  surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.

items.name: Sculpt Element
entries: You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature or an object) for 1 hour.

spell.name: Find Steed
entries: You gain the service of an otherworldly being, which manifests as a loyal steed in an unoccupied space of your choice within range.
This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Steed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} stat block. If you already have a steed from this spell, your steed is replaced by the new one.

The steed resembles a Large, rideable animal of your choice, such as a horse, a camel, a dire wolf, or an elk. Whenever you cast the spell, choose the steed's creature type—Celestial, Fey, or Fiend—which determines certain traits in the stat block.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The steed is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, it shares your initiative count, and it functions as a controlled mount (as defined in the rules on mounted combat). If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition,  it takes its turn immediately after yours and acts independently, focusing on protecting you.

entries.name: Disappearance of the Steed
entries: The steed disappears if it drops to 0 Hit Points, if you dismiss it as a Bonus Action, or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast this spell again, you decide whether you summon the steed that disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Hunter's Mark
entries: You choose one creature you can see within range and magically mark it as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Force damage to the target the first time you hit it with an attack roll on any turn. You also have  Advantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival}) check you make to find it.
If the target drops to 0 Hit Points before this  spell ends, you can use a Bonus Action to mark a  new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or  higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours, and the extra  damage increases to {@dice 3d6}.

spell.name: Power Word Heal
entries: A wave of healing energy washes over a creature you can see within range. The target regains all its Hit Points. If the creature has the {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Dazed|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}, {@condition Frightened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, or {@condition Stunned} condition, the condition ends. If the creature has the {@condition Prone} condition, it can use its reaction to stand up.

spell.name: Power Word Kill
entries: You utter a word of power that can compel one creature you can see within range to die instantly. If the creature you choose has 100 Hit Points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, the target takes {@damage 12d12} Psychic damage.

spell.name: Searing Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a target with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}

entries: As you hit the target, your strike flares with white-hot intensity, and the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage and ignites with magical fire. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d6} Fire damage.
On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shining Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: As you hit the creature, your strike flares with divine light. The target hit by the strike takes an  extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage from the attack. If the  target has the {@condition Invisible|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition, that condition ends on it. In addition, until the spell ends, the  target sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius, attack rolls against it have Advantage, and it can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra  damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Staggering Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}

entries: As you hit the creature, your strike pierces both body and mind. The target takes an extra {@damage 4d6} Psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Stunned} condition until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 5th level, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a target with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}

entries: As you hit the target, your strike rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Thunder damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and have the {@condition Prone} condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vicious Mockery
entries: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature you can see or  hear within range. The target must succeed on a  Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach certain Bard levels: 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Wrathful Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6}

entries: As you hit the creature, your strike channels divine wrath. The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage from the attack, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened} condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Frightened} target repeats the saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a Spell Slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a throw of the net at a creature within 15 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Dexterity modifier. The target succeeds automatically if it's Huge or larger.

On a failed save, the target has the Restrained condition until it escapes the net. To escape, the target must use its action to make a {@dc 10} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, escaping on a success. A creature within 5 feet of the target can use its action to attempt the same thing. Destroying the net (AC 10; 5 HP; immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage) also frees the target, ending the effect.

item.name: Priest's Pack
entries: Includes:

entries.name: Light
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} Action on your turn and attack with a Light weapon in one hand and have a Light weapon in the other hand, you can make one extra attack as part of the same Action. That extra attack must be made with the Light weapon in the other hand, and you don't add your ability modifier to the extra attack's damage. You can make this extra attack only once on each of your turns.

For example, if you take the {@action Attack|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} Action on your turn and have a Shortsword in one hand and a Dagger in the other—each of which has the Light property—you can make one attack with each weapon, but you don't add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage roll of the second weapon.

itemMastery.name: Cleave
entries: If you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, you can make an attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon's damage, but don't add your ability modifier to that damage, unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

itemMastery.name: Flex
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using this weapon, you deal its Versatile damage even if you're wielding it with one hand.

itemMastery.name: Graze
entries: If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can't be increased in any way, other than increasing the ability modifier.

itemMastery.name: Nick
entries: When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the {@action Attack|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} action, instead of as a Bonus Action. You can still make this extra attack only once per turn.

itemMastery.name: Push
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you if it is no more than one size larger than you.

itemMastery.name: Sap
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

itemMastery.name: Slow
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If you hit the creature more than once with this property, the Speed reduction doesn't exceed 10 feet.

itemMastery.name: Topple
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Prone} condition.

itemMastery.name: Vex
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

hp.special: 5 + five times your Ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Ranger level)

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the beast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Maul attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Spell Save DC or have the {@condition Prone} condition.

trait.name: Primal Bond
entries: You can add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw that the beast makes.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 2 + PB} Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice when you summon the beast).

hp.special: 5 + five times your Ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Ranger level)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The beast can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Primal Bond
entries: You can add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw that the beast makes.

action.name: Binding Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 2 + PB} Bludgeoning or Piercing damage (your choice), and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XUA2023PlayersHandbookP6} condition (escape DC equals your Spell Save DC). Until this grapple ends, the beast can't use this attack on another target.

hp.special: 4 + four times your Ranger level (the beast has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your Ranger level)
